He sinks onto the couch, clutching his phone, feeling the weight of time slipping away, helpless to halt its relentless march.

Triggering Event: He sat alone in his empty apartment, flipping through old photographs. A faded Polaroid of him and his estranged brother laughing at a picnic caught his eye. He traced their smiles, feeling the familiar ache of loneliness. His phone buzzed - another invitation to a wedding he wouldn't attend. The melancholy settled heavier as he set the photo aside, another reminder of time passing without him.

Triggering Event: While sorting through his late wife's belongings, he finds an unopened letter addressed to him in her handwriting.

At first, I felt a mix of emotions—surprise at how much she had written, guilt over the memories I had forgotten, and perhaps a hint of sadness that these private thoughts were now out in the open. As I delved deeper into the letter, I started to feel a sense of betrayal. I realized that every moment we spent together, every conversation we had, every laugh we shared—it was all part of a story I couldn’t fully grasp. Triggering Event: She arrived home from her shift at the restaurant to find the dishwasher still hadn't been emptied, despite it being well past midnight and her husband having been asleep for hours. The faint smell of last night's garlic still lingered in the air.
Generated Assessment: It's so weird that she left work early today, I thought they closed up by 10pm, but apparently they stayed open until 11:30. This is really all I can think about right now - how much more time she wasted working, and how much stress this puts on us. We're going to have to pay someone to come clean the dishes tonight because she won't even bother doing it herself. It's just another reminder of what kind of lazy, irresponsible person she is. I'm so tired of dealing with this shit.

His disdain is palpable, yet he maintains a professional facade as he turns back to his charts.
